children.subject: I am super happy and honored to initiate this program! Please RSVP to secure your seat and share it with your friends!! See you on 2.14!

Thank you for hosting this! As an Asian-American I've often wondered if there were any programs such as this. Often times Asians are marginalized and no help or support given professionally or academically.
TOPPA @ Berkeley kickoff event welcome and encourage everyone to join us! We will cover your question at the event! Hoping to see you on 2.14.
You can use your school email and your personal email!
When I filled out the form for credits, it says only $100 - how do you get the $200?
Unfortunately, due to the high demand, we will only be providing the application link for students who attended the event. Sorry for the inconvenience. But please feel free to drop in.
Will we still be allowed to be a part of the program if we can't make the kickoff?

history.content:
Hello everyone! This is Abby Cai and I am initiating a mentorship program with Google this year. "TOPPA @ Berkeley" is a career development, elite mentorship program founded by Google VP, Meagan Pi, and Berkeley College of Engineering Dean, Tsu-Jae King Liu. We are excited that TOPPA’s first external collaboration is with UC Berkeley and aiming to help more East Asian students in engineering and science domains to break the ceiling in their career paths.

The kick-off event will take place on Feb. 14th, from 6:00-8:00 PM, at Woz Lounge, Soda Hall. Food, cool Google gadget, and $200 Google Cloud Credit will be provided!

  • Facebook event link for the Kick off:  https://www.facebook.com/events/255886981973619/?active_tab=about
  • RSVP link: https://goo.gl/forms/P8TCh6B0w6NIpql63
  • Free $200 Google Cloud Platform Credit: https://preview.tinyurl.com/EECSstudent

Please feel free to reach out to me at abby_cai1018@berkeley.edu if you have any questions.
history.subject: TOPPA @ Berkeley---  Google Mentorship Program
